meanings.definition: A wind blowing in the same direction as the course of a moving object, such as an aircraft or ship.
meanings.sent1: The airplane flew faster thanks to the tailwind pushing it forward.
meanings.sent2: The sailors were grateful for the tailwind that helped them reach their destination sooner.
meanings.sent3: The tailwind was like a helpful friend guiding the ship effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: With the tailwind at their backs, the cyclists felt unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The tailwind whispered encouragement as it propelled the boat forward.

meanings.definition: A favorable or advantageous situation or condition.
meanings.sent1: The team worked hard to maintain the tailwind of success they were experiencing.
meanings.sent2: Having supportive friends can be a great tailwind in achieving your goals.
meanings.sent3: Finding a parking spot right in front of the store was a lucky tailwind.
meanings.sent4: The tailwind of good luck seemed to follow her wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: Her positive attitude acted as a tailwind, propelling her towards her dreams.
